text:
Mariah Carey took her twins Moroccan and Monroe on a daring day out to celebrate July 4 - swimming with sharks.

The We Belong Together singer posted photos and video on her Instagram page on Independence Day of her and the six-year-olds in the ocean with the supposedly “gentle” nurse sharks

The pair looked completely fearless as they were surrounded by the sharks, which are harmless to humans and tend to be found in shallow, warm waters.

“Shark day with #dembabies ... don’t worry, they’re gentle #NurseSharks,” wrote Mariah in her post on the social media site. Also along for the watery ride was the singer’s on-off backup dancer boyfriend Bryan Tanaka, who also shared a video of himself swimming with the bottom-dwelling sharks. The animals, which eat mainly small fish, shrimp and squid, can grow up to 14 feet (4.3 meters) and have very strong jaws filled with thousands of tiny, serrated teeth, which they use to bite defensively if stepped on or bothered by divers who assume they’re docile.

In another picture which showed Mariah petting one of the sharks, the star looked stunning in a wetsuit unzipped to her cleavage. She also revealed her rarely seen adventurous side in a video of herself and Monroe snorkelling in the shallow water with the creatures.

“Swimming with sharks,” Mariah she captioned the clip. “Perfectly normal.”
title: Mariah Carey takes twins swimming with 'gentle' sharks

meta_data.description: Mariah Carey took her twins Moroccan and Monroe on a daring day out to celebrate July 4 - swimming with sharks.
